home.aboutMeDescription: Who am I? I am a computer enthusiast and software developer who will soon be pursuing a Bachelor's of Computer Science at Concordia University.
home.aboutMeDescription2: I am interested in a multitude of aspects within the field, such as app design, databases, and web development. My aim is to improve the lives of the users I program for!
home.technologiesDescription: Throughout the development of my projects, I have become familiar with the following technologies:

projects.mainHeader: Here are some of the projects I've worked on! Click on a project to view its details.

moneroOceanCustomUi.infoPageDescription: A customizable dashboard UI that allows MoneroOcean miners to view their stats, transaction reports, blocks, and more from the MoneroOcean REST API! Includes the ability to change threshold and theme.

elliptiKeys.infoPageDescription:
Implemented using Angular and the Blockchain.com Data API, ElliptiKeys is a sequential database containing every single Bitcoin private/public key in existance, created for the purpose of educating the general public about the security of the Bitcoin network and 256-bit ECC.

Yes, your private key is on here somewhere. No, no one will ever find it.

hellaGoodPizza.infoPageDescription: A test pizza restaurant website that demonstrates the four main C-R-U-D operations in a relational database, as well as user roles, permissions, and authentication. Written using .NET Core MVC with Entity Framework Core to handle database interactions. Developed in collaboration with overflow-gitch and philaube as the final project for Fall 2021 Web Programming III course.

largeHashronCollider.infoPageDescription: Try your luck at searching for coins amongst the possible 2^256 Bitcoin keys! Based off of Kimbatt's btc-address-generator

bitcoinClock.infoPageDescription: A clock that displays the time estimation of Bitcoin's block reward halving. Other data such as blocks until halvening, blockchain height, current/future block rewards, and price are also shown. Made with SevenSeg.js.

covidSimulator.infoPageDescription: An adjustable simulator meant to show how COVID-19 and other viruses spread among a population. Developed in collaboration with overflow-gitch and philaube.. Created as the final project for Winter 2020 User Interfaces course.

tnnfBudgetViewer.infoPageDescription: A WPF financial planning app that lets the user manage different categories and expenses. Allows the user to create as many budget plans as they want and import them. Developed in collaboration with overflow-gitch and philaube. Created as the final project for Winter 2021 Application Development I course.

xvbGui.infoPageDescription:
A WPF dashboard application that retrieves pool and miner data on the XMRvsBEAST Monero Mining Pool. Allows the user to monitor payouts, boosts, and bonuses for up to three Monero addresses. For people who enjoy watching the markets, selectable exchange rates are displayed in-app.

Due to the pool's shutdown in favor of decentralized mining, this client has been deprecated and the source code has been archived. It can still be forked to use any pool's API.

tnnfContainers.infoPageDescription:
An IoT system designed to control and monitor Raspberry Pi container farms. There are two primary components: The Python scripts running on the Pi sending the telemetry to the Azure IoT Hub, and the Xamarin Forms app that interacts with the IoT Hub. Developed in collaboration with overflow-gitch and philaube as the Winter 2022 graduation project.

Documentation available here
